translation: Doing so mentally and following that mentally, these are the causes and conditions that lead to death, and this monk and nun attain the indefinite abode of Pārājika.

translation: If that monk or nun asks or doesn't ask questions later, he or she purifies himself or herself in order to avoid wrongdoing by saying, 'I don't know that I know and don't see that I see, which is a false and vacuous statement.'

source_sentence: 除增上慢，是比丘尼得波羅夷不共住。
translation: Freed from overweening pride, this monk and nun attains the status of a bhāraṇī not living together.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，欲盛變心，受男子種種摩觸，髮際已下、膝已上、肘已後，是比丘尼得波羅夷不共住。
translation: "If a monk or nun who has a desire to intensify his change of mind and receives various kinds of touch from a man, whether it's at the ends of his hair, above his knees, or behind his elbows, this monk or nun attains the distinctive status of a bhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，欲盛變心，受男子捉手、捉衣、共期獨、共行獨、共住獨、共語獨、共一座坐、身親近男子。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun with a desire to be transformed accepts a man's hand, hand-holding robe, proximity to a man alone, proximity to a man in practice, proximity to a man in residence, proximity to a man in speech, proximity to a man in sitting, or proximity to a man in body.

source_sentence: 八法具者，是比丘尼得波羅夷不共住。
translation: When these eight qualities are present, that monk or nun attains the status of a bhāraṇī who doesn't live together.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，知僧如法與比丘作不見罪羯磨，諸比丘不共住、不共事、不共語，而隨順之。
translation: "Suppose monks and nuns know that the saṃgha according to the teaching makes a karman to a monk not to commit a sin, and the monks don't dwell together, don't do things together, and don't speak together, but they follow it.

source_sentence: 諸比丘尼語是比丘尼：『姊妹！
translation: The monks and nuns said to those monks and nuns, 'Sister!

translation: After this monk makes a karman for not seeing an offense, the monks don't live together, don't work together, and don't speak together, so don't follow it.'

source_sentence: 如是諫，堅持不捨，應第二、第三諫。

source_sentence: 不捨者，是比丘尼得波羅夷不共住。
translation: When they don't abandon them, that monk or nun attains the status of a bhāraṇī who doesn't dwell together.

source_sentence: 彼比丘尼後時，若在、若死、若遠行、若被擯、若罷道、若變形，作是語：『我先親見其犯波羅夷。』
translation: If that monk or nun later becomes present, dies, travels far, is rejected, leaves the path, or takes on a new form, he says, 'I personally saw him violate the paranirmita-vaśavartin.'

source_sentence: 是比丘尼得波羅夷不共住。」

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，行媒法，若為私通事，持男意至女邊、持女意至男邊，乃至一交會，是比丘尼初犯僧伽婆尸沙可悔過。
translation: "If a monk or nun practices matchmaking and, for the purpose of illicit sexual intercourse, carries a man's intention to a woman's side or a woman's intention to a man's side, even in a single sexual encounter, this is a monk or nun who first violates the saṃghâvaśeṣa and is capable of repentance.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，自不如法惡瞋故，以無根波羅夷謗無波羅夷比丘尼，欲破彼梵行。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun, because of his own unrighteous anger, denigrates a monk or nun without pārājika because he has no religious faculties, intending to undermine his religious practice.

source_sentence: 是比丘尼後時，若問若不問，言：『我是事無根，住瞋故謗。』
translation: If that monk's nun asks or doesn't ask questions later, he says, 'This is a matter of me having no faculties and standing in anger and therefore denigrating them.'

source_sentence: 是比丘尼初犯僧伽婆尸沙可悔過。
translation: This is a repentable initial offense by a monk and nun against the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，自不如法惡瞋故，於異分中取片、若似片，作波羅夷謗無波羅夷比丘尼，欲破彼梵行。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun, because of his own bad anger that's contrary to the teaching, takes a piece or seeming piece of some other part and misrepresents a monk or nun without a piece of pārājika, intending to undermine his religious practice.

source_sentence: 是比丘尼後時，若問若不問，言：『我是事異分中取片、若似片，住瞋故謗。』
translation: If that monk's nun asks or doesn't ask questions later, he says, 'This is a matter of taking a piece or seeming piece of something different and denigrating it because I'm holding onto my anger.'

translation: This is a repentable offense by a monk and nun who first violated the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，知有罪女，主不聽，度為道，除先出家，是比丘尼初犯僧伽婆尸沙可悔過。
translation: "If a monk or nun knows that there's a woman who's guilty but whose master won't listen to her and has made her the author of the path, except for leaving home first, this is a monk or nun who first violates Saṃghâvaśeṣa and is capable of repentance.

translation: "If a monk or nun knows that the saṃgha has lawfully expelled a monk or nun, and the monk or nun's mind is not disciplined and he doesn't obey the saṃgha, then he or she and his or her retinue will relinquish the saṃgha outside the boundary, which is a repentable first offense for a monk or nun.

translation: "Suppose a monk or nun sleeping alone, crossing water alone, or standing alone behind someone in the path becomes defiled by a man.

translation: These are called causes and conditions that arise when they're afraid to walk, when they're too old and tired to be accompanied, when the water is narrow and shallow and there's a bridge or boat, and when they're afraid of men.

translation: "If a monk or nun goes to an official and tells someone that it's a monk or nun who has first violated the saṃghâvaśeṣa, that's repentable.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，有染著心，自手受染著心男子食食，是比丘尼初犯僧伽婆尸沙可悔過。
translation: "If a monk or nun with a defiled mind accepts food from a man with a defiled mind with his own hands, this is a monk or nun who first violates the saṃghâvaśeṣa and is capable of repentance.

translation: "Suppose a monk nun teaches another monk nun to say, 'Don't become defiled; what's the pain of accepting food and drink from a defiled man?'

source_sentence: 是比丘尼初犯僧伽婆尸沙可悔過。
translation: This is a repentable offense by a monk or nun who first violates the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，為破和合僧勤方便。
translation: "Suppose monks and nuns diligently work to disrupt the harmony of the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 諸比丘尼語是比丘尼：『汝莫為破和合僧勤方便，當與僧和合。
translation: The monks and nuns say to this monk and nun, 'Don't work hard to break the harmony of the saṃgha, for you will be in harmony with the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 僧和合故，歡喜無諍，一心一學如水乳合，共弘師教，安樂行。』
translation: Because the saṃgha is brought into harmony, they'll rejoice without disputing, unite their minds and training like water and milk, and work together to promote the teacher's teaching in a peaceful way.'

translation: Thus remonstrating, they insist on not relinquishing it, and they should remonstrate a second and third time.

translation: The second and third admonitions to disregard are good deeds.

translation: Someone who doesn't relent is a monk or nun who has violated the three admonitions of the Saṃghâvaśeṣa and can repent.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，助破和合僧，若一若二若眾多，語諸比丘尼言：『是比丘尼所說，是知說非不知說、說法不說非法、說律不說非律，皆是我等心所忍樂。』
translation: "Suppose monks and nuns assist in refuting the harmony of the saṃgha, whether one, two, or many, and say to the monks and nuns, 'What the monks and nuns say that they know and don't know is said, that they speak what's not said, that they speak what's unlawful, and that they speak what's legal and don't speak what's not legal is tolerated by our minds.'

source_sentence: 諸比丘尼語是比丘尼：『汝莫作是語：「是比丘尼所說，是知說非不知說、說法不說非法、說律不說非律，皆是我等心所忍樂。」
translation: The monks and nuns said to those monks and nuns, 'Don't say this, 'What the monks and nuns say, knowing and not knowing what's said, speaking Dharma and not speaking what's unlawful, and speaking the Vinaya and not speaking what's unlawful, are all tolerated by our minds.'

translation: 'This is a nun who doesn't know and speak the teaching, doesn't expound the Dharma, and doesn't expound the Vinaya, so don't be happy to help break the harmony of the saṃgha.

translation: You should happily assist the reconciling saṃgha, who, because of the reconciliation of the saṃgha, rejoice without disputation, unite their minds and training like water and milk, and work together to promote the teacher's teaching and practice in comfort.'

source_sentence: (五十)「若比丘尼，無病，為炙故自然火、若使人然，波逸提。
translation: (50) "Suppose a monk or nun who has no illness naturally burns or makes others burn for the sake of it, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，若寶等物，若自取、若使人取，除僧坊內及宿處，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun takes something precious, such as jewelry, for himself or for others to take, except in the monastery or in a lodging place, it's a pāyattika.

source_sentence: 若僧坊內及宿處取寶等物，後有主索應還。
translation: If they take jewelry or other things from inside the saṃgha's quarters or from a place where they stay overnight, then a subsequent claimant should return them.

source_sentence: 是事應爾。
translation: This should be the case.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，半月內浴，除因緣，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun takes a bath within half a month, except for a cause and condition, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 因緣者，病時、作時、行路時、風雨時、熱時，是名因緣。
translation: These are called causes and conditions when they're ill, when they're working, when they're walking, when it's raining, and when it's hot.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，瞋故打比丘尼，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun beats a monk or nun because of anger, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，瞋故以手擬比丘尼，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun, out of anger, draws his or her hand against a monk and nun, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，故恐怖比丘尼，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun terrorizes a monk and nun out of anger, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，以無根僧伽婆尸沙謗比丘尼，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun denigrates a monk or nun with a faceless crimesa, it's Pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，語彼比丘尼：『共到諸家，與汝多美飲食。』
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun says to another monk or nun, 'Let's go to their house together and give you a lot of nice food and drink.'

source_sentence: 既到不與，作是言：『汝去。
translation: When they arrive and don't give it to him, they say, 'Go away.

source_sentence: 共汝若坐若語不樂，我獨坐獨語樂。』
translation: It would be unpleasant to sit or talk with you, but it would be pleasant for me to sit alone and talk to you.'

source_sentence: 欲令惱故，波逸提。
translation: That's why I want to disturb you, Bhāviveka.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，新衣應三種色作幟，若青、若黑、若木蘭。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun makes a flag of his new robes in three colors, whether blue, black, or magnolia.

source_sentence: 若不以三色作幟，波逸提。
translation: If you don't make a banner of those three colors, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，為戲笑故，藏比丘尼若衣若鉢、若坐具針筒，如是一一生活具，若使人藏，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun hides, for the purpose of making fun of, some of the monk's robes, some of his bowl, some of his sitting cloth, some of his syringe, and so on, all of the necessities of life, and he asks someone to hide them, Bhāviveka.

source_sentence: (六十)「若比丘尼，僧斷事時如法與欲竟，後更呵，波逸提。
translation: (60) "Suppose a monk or nun, after fulfilling his or her duties to the saṃgha and according to the teaching, then ridicules him or her again, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，作是語：『諸比丘尼隨知識迴僧物與。』
translation: "Suppose monks and nuns say, 'Suppose monks and nuns follow their teachers and return the property of the saṃgha.'

source_sentence: 波逸提。
translation: (Skt. prāsāda).

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與比丘、比丘尼、式叉摩那、沙彌、沙彌尼淨施衣，強奪取，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun gives a monk, a bhikṣuṇī, a śrāmaṇer, or a novice purely for charity and then forcibly takes it, it's called 'pāyattika.'

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，受他請，食前食後行到諸家，不近白餘比丘尼，除因緣。
translation: "If a monk or nun accepts another person's invitation and goes to their house after eating, and doesn't go near the other monks and nuns to tell them about it, that removes the cause and condition.

source_sentence: 波逸提。
translation: Pāyatti!

source_sentence: 因緣者，衣時，是名因緣。
translation: A cause and condition is called a condition when it comes to clothing.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，以兜羅貯坐臥具，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun stores a pallet of sitting and bedding in a hut, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，自作坐臥繩床木床，足應高修伽陀八指，除入梐。
translation: "If a monk or nun makes his own bed or seat of rope or wood, his feet should be raised eight fingers above the saugata, and he should be removed from the stockade.

source_sentence: 若過，波逸提。
translation: If that's not the case, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，用骨牙角作針筒，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun makes a needle out of bone, tooth, and horn, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，作修伽陀衣量衣、若過，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun makes a measure of a sugata robe, and if it's wrong, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 修伽陀衣量者，長九修伽陀磔手、廣六磔手，是名修伽陀衣量。
translation: A sugata-robe measure is nine long sugata hands and six broad sugata hands, which is called a sugata-robe measure.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，知檀越欲與僧物，迴與餘人，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun knows that a donor wants to give away the property of the saṃgha and returns it to another person, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，噉蒜，波逸提。
translation: "If monks and nuns gnaw garlic, that's pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: (七十)「若比丘尼，以手拍女根，波逸提。
translation: (70) "Suppose a monk or nun slaps a woman's faculties with his or her hand, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，作男根內女根中，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun makes a man's root go inside a woman's root, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，以水洗女根，應用二指齊一節。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun washes the female faculty with water and applies two fingers together at one joint.

source_sentence: 若過，波逸提。
translation: If that's not the case, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，剃腋下、隱處毛，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun shaves the hair under his armpits and in his private parts, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與比丘獨屏處共立共語，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun stand alone with a monk and talk to each other, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與白衣及外道獨屏處共立共語，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun stand alone with a white robe or a lay follower and speak together, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與比丘獨露處共立共語，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun stand alone with a monk and speak together, Bhakṣuṇī.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與白衣及外道獨露處共立共語，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun stand up together with a white robe and a non-Buddhist in a solitary place and talk to each other, Bhāviveka.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與比丘獨街巷中共立耳語，遣伴比丘尼令遠去，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun stand alone with a monk in a street and talk to each other, and then they send their companion monk and nun away, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與白衣及外道獨行巷中共立耳語，遣伴比丘尼令遠去，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun stands up with a white clothed man or a layman alone in an alleyway and whispers in his ear, and he sends his companion monk or nun to make him leave, Bhāviveka.

source_sentence: (八十)「若比丘尼，裸形洗浴，波逸提。
translation: (80) "Suppose a monk or nun washes his or her naked body, prāyaṇa.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，離水，浴衣行，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun stands out of the water and walks in his bathing suit, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，比丘尼得新衣，先以供養，便不復還，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun makes an offering to a new robe that's first obtained by the monk or nun, and then he or she doesn't return it, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，遮僧分衣，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun covers up the saṃgha's portion of the robe, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，撤比丘尼衣已，無病過四五日不成，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun removes a monk's nun's robe and then doesn't wear it for more than four or five days without illness, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，離五衣行，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun depart from the five garment practices, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，以比丘尼衣與白衣及外道女，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun gives a white robe and a lay woman the monk's nun's robe, it's a pārājikā.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，斷施人物與僧，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun stops giving to the monks and community, it's a pārājika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，護惜他家，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun protects and cherishes other people's homes, it's pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，不安居，波逸提。
translation: "If monks and nuns don't live in peace, it's a pārājikā.

source_sentence: (九十)「若比丘尼，不依比丘眾安居，波逸提。
translation: (90) "If a monk or nun doesn't rely on the community of monks for a peaceful dwelling, it's pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，於安居內遊行，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun wanders about in his or her quiet abode, it's a pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，安居竟不從比丘僧請見聞疑罪，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun who has finished her retreat doesn't follow the monks' invitation to see and hear about a crime, it's a pārājikā.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，就安居請竟，一宿不去，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun who has finished inviting others to their retreat doesn't leave for a night, it's a pārājika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，於國內恐怖處，無所依怙而獨行者，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun goes into a place of domestic fear without support and walks alone, it's a misdeed, Bhāviveka.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，出國境恐怖處，無所依怙而獨行者，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun goes out of the country into a place of fear and has no support and travels alone, prāyaṇa.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼安居竟，不付囑精舍出行者，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun goes out to a place of fear in a country without a support, that's Bhakṣuṇī.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼安居竟，不捨精舍還主去者，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun who has finished settling down doesn't abandon his or her abode and return to the master, that's what happened, Bhāviveka.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，種種遊看，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun travels around in various ways, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，半月不於僧中乞教誡師，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun doesn't go to the saṃgha for half a month to ask for a teacher to admonish them, it's pāyattika.

source_sentence: (一百)「若比丘尼，入有比丘住處，見比丘不白，除急難時，波逸提。
translation: (100) "If a monk or nun enters a monk's dwelling and sees that he doesn't explain himself, that removes an urgent problem, Bhāṣṭi.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，不滿十二歲畜眷屬，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun who is younger than 12 years old keeps his retinue, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，滿十二歲，僧不與作畜眾羯磨，畜眾者，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun who has reached the age of 12 doesn't receive a monastic order to feed the crowd and feeds the crowd, that's what happened, Bhāṣṭi.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與未滿十二歲已嫁女受具足戒，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun gives the full precepts to a married woman who's under 12 years old, that's pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，滿十二歲已嫁女，僧不作羯磨，與受具足戒，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun who has married a woman who has reached the age of 12 doesn't receive the full precepts without a kalpa from the saṃgha, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與未滿十八歲童女受學戒，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun trains a young girl under 18 years of age to receive the precepts, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，雖滿十八歲童女，僧不作羯磨，與受學戒，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun gives a young woman who's at least 18 years old the precepts for training without a monastic act of karman, pāyatti.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，語白衣歸女：『先與我衣，我當度汝。』
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun says to a girl in white clothing who returns to him, 'Give me your robe first, and I will save you.'

source_sentence: 波逸提。
translation: (Skt. pratyekabuddha).

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，諸比丘尼語言：『如佛所說，應與作畜眾羯磨。
translation: "Suppose monks and nuns say, 'As the Buddha has taught, you should perform the karman of the monks and nuns.

source_sentence: 汝無是事。』
translation: You don't have such a thing.'

source_sentence: 便呵諸比丘尼者，波逸提。
translation: That's the way you would ridicule the nuns, Bhakṣuṇī.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，教誡及羯磨時不往聽，波逸提。
translation: "If the monks and nuns don't listen when they're being instructed or when they're being given the karma, that's what happened, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: (一百一十)「若比丘尼，式叉摩那滿二歲無難，不與受具足戒，語言：『汝且學是戒。』
translation: (110) "Suppose a monk or nun who has reached the age of two years and has no difficulty accepting the full set of precepts says, 'You may study these precepts.'

source_sentence: 波逸提。
translation: (Skt. prāyattika).

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，度婬女，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun commits sexual misconduct with a girl, prāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與未滿二歲學戒尼受具足戒，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun gives the full precepts to a nun who's less than two years old and has studied the precepts, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，滿二歲學戒尼，僧不作羯磨，與受具足戒，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun who have completed the second year of training in the precepts and the saṃgha doesn't perform the karma, and he or she receives the full precepts, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與滿二歲學戒尼不學戒，受具足戒，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun who has completed the second year of training in the precepts and doesn't train in the precepts, he or she receives the full precepts, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與懷妊女受具足戒，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun gives the full precepts to a pregnant woman, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與新產婦受具足戒，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun confers the full precepts on a newly pregnant woman, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，年年與弟子受具足戒，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun observes the full precepts with a disciple every year, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，異宿與弟子受具足戒，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun receive the full precepts with a disciple from another night, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，新受具足戒，不六年依承和上、若使人依承者，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun who has just received the full precepts doesn't rely on Vātsīputrī for six years or make others rely on him, that's pāyattika.

source_sentence: (一百二十)「若比丘尼，畜弟子，六年中不自攝取、不教人攝取，波逸提。
translation: (120) "If a monk or nun takes a disciple under his wing and doesn't collect it for six years or teach others to collect it, it's a pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，畜弟子，不自將、不使人將離本處五六由旬，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun takes a disciple into his custody and doesn't bring or cause others to bring him away from his place for five or six leagues, it's pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，同學病，不自看、不教人看，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun studying with a student who's ill doesn't examine himself and doesn't teach others to examine him, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，度屬人婦女，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun sends a subordinate woman to live with him, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，度長病女人，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun helps a woman who's chronically ill, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，度屬夫婦人，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun deliver a wife and a man, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，度負債女人，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun sends a woman in debt, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與男子闇處共立共語，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun stand in a dark place with a man and speak together, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，不語主人輒坐其座，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun sits on his or her seat without speaking to the host, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，自手與白衣及外道男子食，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun gives food with his own hands to a man in white robes or a non-Buddhist, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: (一百三十)「若比丘尼，向白衣說比丘過，波逸提。
translation: (130) "Suppose a monk and nun explain a monk's faults to a white-clothed man, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與人鬪已，自打啼哭，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun fight with someone and then beat and cry on their own, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，不諦了人語，妄瞋他，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun doesn't understand the words of others and falsely assumes the anger of others, it's a pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼自呪誓實以呪彼。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun incurs a spell on himself, vowing to really incant that person.

source_sentence: 波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun throws up excrement, pratyekabuddha, that monk or nun will then curse that monk or nun.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，擲屎尿於籬牆外、若使人擲，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun throws excrement or urine outside a hedge wall or causes someone to throw it, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，擲糞掃及殘食於籬牆外、若使人擲，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun throws dung or leftover food outside a hedge or wall, or if someone throws it at them, that's what happened, Bhāviveka.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，於生草上大小便，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun urinates or defecates on raw grass, it's a pārājika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，擲糞掃、殘食生草上，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun throws a litter tray or leftover food onto the living grass, it's a pārājika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，於有食家宿，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun stays overnight in a house where there's food, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，若比丘如法問不答，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun asks or doesn't answer a monk's question according to the teaching, that's what happened, Bhāviveka.

source_sentence: (一百四十)「若比丘尼，乘乘行，波逸提。
translation: (140) "If a monk or nun travels by vehicle, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，著革屣捉蓋行來，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun walks around wearing leather sandals and grabbing a lid, prāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，捉水瓶及扇立比丘前、若給水若扇，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun grab a flask of water and a fan and stand in front of the monk, offering water or a fan, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，誦治病經方，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun recites the recipe for a healing scripture, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，教他誦治病經方，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun teaches others to recite the prescriptions for sūtras that heal illnesses, prāyatī.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，為人治病以為生業，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun treats people's illnesses as a way to produce work, prāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，教他治病以為生業，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun teaches others to heal illnesses in order to produce karma, prāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，以飲食故為白衣家作，波逸提。

translation: "Suppose a monk and nun share the same clothes and bed with a monk and nun, a pratyekabuddha, or a novice nun, pāyattika.

source_sentence: (一百五十)「若比丘尼，與白衣及外道婦女更相覆眠，波逸提。
translation: (150) "Suppose a monk or nun sleeps with a white-clothed or lay woman in his or her bed, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與比丘尼、式叉摩那、沙彌尼更相覆眠，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun share the same sleeping quarters with a bhikṣuṇī, a Śikṣamāṇā, or a novice nun, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，以香塗身，波逸提。

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，畜華鬘若著，波逸提。

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，著寶腰絡，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun wears a jeweled waistband, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，著裨身衣，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun wear robes that match their bodies, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘，尼畜種種嚴身具，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun store various ornamental body parts, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，畜髲，波逸提。

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，髮長，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun have long hair, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: (一百六十)「若比丘尼，著嚴身具，波逸提。
translation: (160) "Suppose a monk and nun wear ornamental body gear, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，為他作嚴身具，波逸提。

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，績縷，波逸提。

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，不問白衣輒在其家敷臥具住，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun lays out a bed and bedding for a white clothed man in his house without asking him, prāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，至白衣家敷其坐臥具、若使人敷，去時不自舉、不教人舉，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun goes to a white clothed person's house to lay out his or her sitting and bedding, or if he or she asks someone else to lay it out, and then doesn't lift it himself or tell someone else to lift it when he leaves, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，自煮生物作食，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun cooks living creatures for himself to eat, prāyaṇa.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，先聽住後慎誘者，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun first listens to someone's abiding and then carefully entices them, it's a pārājika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼不白僧輒使男子治病。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun readily allows a man to treat a sickness without telling the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，夜輒開都門出，不語餘比丘尼令閉，波逸提。

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，白衣不喚非時入其家，波逸提。

source_sentence: (一百七十)「若比丘尼，受請，主人未唱隨意，食者，波逸提。

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，被驅出羯磨，不去者，波逸提。

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，僧如法集會，不即往，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun does not go immediately to the assembly of the saṃgha according to the teaching, that's pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，觀歌舞作伎，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun observes singing, dancing, and plays, that's pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，往邊地，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun goes to a side land, it's a pārājikā.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，度二根人，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun passes away a person with two faculties, it's a pārājikā.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，度二道合作一道女人，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun converts a woman who cooperates in two paths and one path, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，度常有月水女人，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun gives refuge to a woman who always has moonlight water, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，見比丘不起不禮不請坐，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk and nun stand up when they see a monk, don't pay respect, and don't ask to sit down, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，燒隱處毛，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun burns the hair in his hiding place, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: (一百八十)「若比丘尼，不著僧祇支入白衣家，波逸提。
translation: (108) "Suppose a monk and nun enter a white-clothed home without wearing a saṃgha, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，與白衣對坐臨身相近說法，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun sits near and speaks to a white-clothed man while he's sitting next to him, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，自歌舞，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun sings and dances on his own, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，遮受迦絺那衣，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun refuses to accept the kaṭhina robe, prājñātaka.

translation: "Suppose a monk or nun refuses to accept the kaṭhina robe, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，不白比丘輒問義者，波逸提。

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，以男子不淨自內形中，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun takes a man's impure inner form, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，作外道事火法然火，波逸提。

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，在有人處浴，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun bathes in someone's place, pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，誦外道呪術、若教人誦，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun recites a non-Buddhist spell or teaches someone to recite it, that's pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: (一百九十)「若比丘尼，一眾授具足戒，波逸提。
translation: (190) "If a group of monks and nuns confers the full precepts, it's a pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，自作畜眾羯磨，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun makes a congregational kalpa of his own, it's a pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，自作二歲學戒羯磨，波逸提。
translation: "If a monk or nun makes a karman of the precepts for two years of training on his own, it's a pāyattika.

source_sentence: 「若比丘尼，自受二歲學戒，波逸提。
translation: "Suppose a monk or nun takes upon himself the precepts for training in the second year of life, pāyattika.

translation: "Those who don't look up and enter the white-robed dwelling should learn.

source_sentence: 「不高視白衣舍坐，應當學。
translation: "Not to look up and sit in the white-robed abode should be learned.

source_sentence: 「不左右顧視入白衣舍，應當學。
translation: "You should train not to look from side to side when entering the white-robed dwelling.

source_sentence: 「不左右顧視白衣舍坐，應當學。
translation: "You should train not to look left or right while sitting in the white-robed dwelling.

source_sentence: 「不蹲行入白衣舍，應當學。
translation: "Those who don't crouch and walk into the white-robed dwelling should learn.

source_sentence: 「不蹲行白衣舍坐，應當學。
translation: "Those who don't squat and walk into the white-robed dwelling and sit there should learn.

source_sentence: (四十)「不企行入白衣舍，應當學。
translation: (40) "Those who don't walk into the white-robed dwelling without attempting to do so should learn.

source_sentence: 「不企行白衣舍坐，應當學。
translation: "Those who don't attempt to walk into the white-robed abode and sit there should learn.

source_sentence: 「不覆頭入白衣舍，應當學。
translation: "Those who don't cover their heads and enter the white-robed dwelling should learn.

source_sentence: 「不覆頭白衣舍坐，應當學。
translation: "Those who don't cover their heads while sitting in the white-robed abode should train.

source_sentence: 「不戲笑入白衣舍，應當學。
translation: "You should train not to laugh or jeer when entering the white-robed dwelling.

source_sentence: 「不戲笑白衣舍坐，應當學。
translation: "You should train not to laugh and sit in the white-robed abode.

source_sentence: 「不高聲入白衣舍，應當學。
translation: "You should train not to raise your voice when entering the white-robed dwelling.

source_sentence: 「不高聲白衣舍坐，應當學。
translation: "Those who don't raise their voices and sit in the white-robed dwelling should learn.

source_sentence: 「庠序入白衣舍，應當學。
translation: "Entering a white-robed dwelling in an orderly fashion should be a lesson.

source_sentence: (五十)「庠序白衣舍坐，應當學。
translation: (50) "Sitting in the white-robed dwelling in front of an asylum should be a lesson to be learned.

source_sentence: 「一心受食，應當學。
translation: "Accepting food with one mind should be done.

source_sentence: 「不溢鉢受食，應當學。
translation: "Accepting food without overflowing one's bowl should be done.

source_sentence: 「羹飯俱食，應當學。
translation: "You should train when you eat from both a bowl and a meal.

source_sentence: 「不於鉢中處處取食，應當學。
translation: "You must learn not to take food from each place in the bowl.

source_sentence: 「不刳中央食，應當學。
translation: "Not to eat from the center of the bowl, you should learn.

source_sentence: 「不曲指抆鉢食，應當學。
translation: "You must learn not to eat from a bowl with your fingers bent.

source_sentence: 「不嗅食食，應當學。
translation: "You must learn not to sniff food.

source_sentence: 「諦視鉢食，應當學。
translation: "You should learn to look closely at food in the bowl.

source_sentence: 「不棄飯食，應當學。
translation: "Not to discard food and drink, it should be learned.

source_sentence: 「不以食手捉淨飲器，應當學。
translation: "Not to grasp a clean drinking vessel with one's hand as one eats, it should be learned.

source_sentence: (六十)「不吸食食，應當學。
translation: (60) "Do not inhale food and drink, and you should learn it.

source_sentence: 「不嚼食作聲，應當學。
translation: "Don't chew food and make noises, and you should learn it.

source_sentence: 「不舐取食，應當學。
translation: "You should learn not to lick food and eat it.

source_sentence: 「不滿手食，應當學。
translation: "Don't eat with your hands, and you should learn.

source_sentence: 「不大張口食，應當學。
translation: "Don't open your mouth wide to eat, and you should learn.

source_sentence: 「飯未至不張口待，應當學。
translation: "When you don't open your mouth to wait until the meal arrives, you should learn.

source_sentence: 「不脹頰食，應當學。
translation: "You should learn not to swell your cheeks to eat.

source_sentence: 「不嚙半食，應當學。
translation: "When you don't eat with your mouth half full, you should learn.

source_sentence: 「不縮鼻食，應當學。
translation: "You must learn not to shrink your nose to eat.

source_sentence: 「不含食語，應當學。
translation: "Don't speak with food in your mouth, and you should learn it.

source_sentence: (七十)「不舒臂取食，應當學。
translation: (70) "When you don't take food with your arms outstretched, you should learn it.

source_sentence: 「不振手食，應當學。
translation: "When you don't eat with your hands raised, you should learn.

source_sentence: 「不吐舌舐食，應當學。
translation: "When you don't lick food with your tongue out, you should learn it.

source_sentence: 「不全吞食，應當學。
translation: "When you don't swallow a meal whole, you should learn it.

source_sentence: 「不揣飯遙擲口中，應當學。
translation: "You must learn not to carry food far enough to toss it into your mouth.

source_sentence: 「不以鉢中有食水灑白衣屋內，應當學。
translation: "You must learn not to sprinkle the white-robed interior of your house with water from the food in your bowl.

source_sentence: 「不以飯覆羹更望得，應當學。
translation: "You should learn not to cover your soup with rice and hope to obtain it again.

source_sentence: 「不嫌呵食，應當學。
translation: "You should learn not to dislike food that's being pushed at you.

source_sentence: 「不為己索益食，應當學。
translation: "Not to seek food for one's own benefit, you should learn.

source_sentence: 「不嫌心視比坐鉢，應當學。
translation: "Not to dislike mentally examining the bowl than you sit on, you should train.

source_sentence: (八十)「不立大小便，除病，應當學。
translation: (80) "It's appropriate to learn not to defecate or urinate and to remove illness.

source_sentence: 「不大小便淨水中，除病，應當學。
translation: "He should learn not to urinate or defecate in clean water to remove illness.

source_sentence: 「不大小便生草菜上，除病，應當學。
translation: "Not defecating on raw grass and vegetables removes illnesses and should be studied.

source_sentence: 「人著履，不應為說法，除病，應當學。
translation: "A person wearing footwear shouldn't preach for the sake of preaching, which should remove illness and should be learned.

source_sentence: 「人著革屣，不應為說法，除病，應當學。
translation: "A person wearing leather sandals should not preach for the sake of preaching, and he should remove illness and should learn.

source_sentence: 「人現胸，不應為說法，除病，應當學。
translation: "A person who shows his chest should not expound the Dharma and should remove illnesses; he should learn.

source_sentence: 「人坐、比丘尼立，不應為說法，除病，應當學。
translation: "A person sitting while a monk or nun is standing shouldn't preach for the sake of preaching, and he should remove illnesses and learn.

source_sentence: 「人在高座、比丘尼在下，不應為說法，除病，應當學。
translation: "A person on a high seat and a monk and nun at a lower seat should not expound the Dharma to remove illnesses; they should learn from it.

source_sentence: 「人臥、比丘尼坐，不應為說法，除，病應當學。
translation: "A person lying down and a bhikṣuṇī sitting should not expound the Dharma and remove illnesses; they should learn.

source_sentence: 「人在前、比丘尼在後，不應為說法，除病，應當學。
translation: "A person in front and a monk and nun behind should not expound the Dharma and remove illnesses; they should learn.

source_sentence: (九十)「人在道中、比丘尼在道外，不應為說法，除病，應當學。
translation: (90) "A person in the path and a monk or nun outside the path should not expound the Dharma and remove illnesses; they should learn.

source_sentence: 「不為覆頭人說法，除病，應當學。
translation: "They should learn not to preach for someone who covers their head and removes illnesses.

source_sentence: 「不為反抄衣人說法，除，病應當學。
translation: "You must learn not to preach for someone copying robes backwards and remove illnesses.

source_sentence: 「不為左右抄衣人說法，除病，應當學。
translation: "You should learn not to preach for someone copying robes from left to right, and you should remove illness.

source_sentence: 「不為持蓋覆身人說法，除病，應當學。
translation: "You must learn not to preach for someone carrying a coverlet over their body and remove illness.

source_sentence: 「不為騎乘人說法，除病，應當學。
translation: "You must learn not to preach for someone riding a horse, and you must remove illness.

source_sentence: 「不為拄杖人說法，除病，應當學。
translation: "You must learn not to preach for a person with a staff to remove illness.

source_sentence: 「不為捉刀人說法，除病，應當學。
translation: "You must learn not to preach for someone who holds a sword and removes illness.

source_sentence: 「不為捉弓箭人說法，除病，應當學。
translation: "You must learn not to preach for someone who holds a bow and arrow and remove illness.

source_sentence: 「樹過人，不得上，除大因緣，應當學。
translation: "A person who goes beyond a tree can't get up there, except for great causes and conditions, which should be studied.

source_sentence: 因緣者，惡獸諸難，是名大因緣。
translation: A cause and condition is the great cause and condition of the difficulties of harmful animals.

source_sentence: (一百)」「諸大姊！
translation: (Hundred)" "Great sisters!

source_sentence: 已說眾學法。
translation: I've already explained the teaching of many trainees.

source_sentence: 今問，諸大姊是中清淨不？」
translation: Now, I'd like to ask, "Are these older sisters pure in the midst of it all?"

source_sentence: (第二、第三亦如是說)「諸大姊是中清淨，默然故，是事如是持。」
translation: (The second and third also say in the same way), "Great sisters, this is pure, and it's maintained in silence."

source_sentence: 「諸大姊，已說戒經序、已說八波羅夷法、已說十七僧伽婆尸沙法、已說三十尼薩耆波逸提法、已說二百一十波逸提法、已說八波羅提提舍尼法、已說眾學戒法。
translation: "Great sisters, the preface of the precepts sūtra has been explained, the eight-part teaching has been explained, the 17-saṃghâvaśeṣa teaching has been explained, the 30-nisaji-prātimokṣa teaching has been explained, the 210-part teaching has been explained, the eight-part prātimokṣa teaching has been explained, and the teaching on the precepts for all students has been explained.

source_sentence: 是法入佛戒經中，半月半月波羅提木叉中說。
translation: This teaching is found in the Buddha's precepts sūtra and is explained in the half-moon and half-moon prātimokṣas.

source_sentence: 及餘隨道法。
translation: And the other teachings that follow the path.

source_sentence: 是中諸大姊，一心和合歡喜不諍，如水乳合，安樂行。
translation: Here, the elder sisters are united in one mind, rejoicing and not disputing, like water and milk coming together, and walking in comfort.

source_sentence: 應當學。」
translation: They should learn it."

source_sentence: 「毘婆尸如來、應、正遍知，為寂靜僧略說波羅提木叉：「『忍辱第一道，　　涅槃佛稱最，　　出家惱他人，　　不名為沙門。』
translation: "Vipaśyin Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Omniscient spoke briefly for the quiescent monks about prātimokṣa, saying, 'The supreme path of forbearance is called the greatest by the Buddha of nirvāṇa, and leaving home and vexing others is not called being an ascetic.'

source_sentence: 「尸棄如來、應、正遍知，為寂靜僧略說波羅提木叉：「『譬如明眼人，　　能避險惡道，　　世有聰明人，　　能遠離諸惡。』
translation: "Tathāgata Śikhin, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Omniscient, spoke briefly to the quiescent monks about prātimokṣa, "It's like a man of discernment who can avoid dangerous paths, or a wise man in the world who can keep away from evil."

source_sentence: 「比葉婆如來、應、正遍知，為寂靜僧略說波羅提木叉：「『不惱不說過，　　如戒所說行，　　飯食知節量，　　常樂在閑處，　　心寂樂精進，　　是名諸佛教。』
translation: "For the quiet monks, the Tathāgata, Arhat, and Perfectly Omniscient One outlined the prātimokṣa, 'Not being vexed and not speaking ill of it, practicing the precepts as they're taught, knowing how to eat and drink in moderation, always delighting in quiet places, and making effort with calmness and joy are called the teachings.'

source_sentence: 「拘留孫如來、應、正遍知，為寂靜僧略說波羅提木叉：「『譬如蜂採花，　　不壞色與香，　　但取其味去。
translation: "Tathāgata Kauśāmbī, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Omniscient, spoke briefly to the Quiet Monks about prātimokṣa, "It's like a bee picking a flower that doesn't spoil its color or fragrance but simply takes its taste and leaves.

source_sentence: 比丘入聚落，　　不破壞他事，　　不觀作不作，　　但自觀身行，　　諦視善不善。』
translation: A monk enters a village, doesn't spoil what others do, doesn't observe what's done or not done, but observes his own actions and carefully examines what's good and not good.'

source_sentence: 「拘那含牟尼如來、應、正遍知，為寂靜僧略說波羅提木叉：「『欲得好心莫放逸，　　聖人善法當勤學，　　若有知寂一心人，　　爾乃無復憂愁患。』
translation: "The Kanakamuni Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Omniscient spoke briefly to the quiescent monks about prātimokṣa, 'Don't be careless in attaining a good mind; the good qualities of noble people should be studied diligently; if there's someone who knows the single mind of quiescence, then there'll be no more grief.'

source_sentence: 「迦葉如來、應、正遍知，為寂靜僧略說波羅提木叉：「『一切惡莫作，　　當具足善法，　　自淨其志意，　　是則諸佛教。』
translation: "The Tathāgata Kauṇḍinya, the Worthy and Perfectly Omniscient One, spoke briefly to the quiescent monks about prātimokṣa, 'Don't do all evil; fulfill the good Dharma; purify your intentions; and this is the teaching of the Buddhas.'

source_sentence: 「釋迦牟尼如來、應、正遍知，為寂靜僧略說波羅提木叉：「『護身為善哉，　　能護口亦善，　　護意為善哉，　　護一切亦善，　　比丘護一切，　　便得離眾苦。
translation: "The Śakyamuni Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Omniscient spoke briefly to the silent monks about prātimokṣa, saying, 'It's good to guard the body, good to guard the mouth, good to guard the mind, and good to guard all things, and a monk who guards all things will be freed from suffering.

source_sentence: 比丘守口意，　　身不犯眾惡，　　是三業道淨，　　得聖所得道。
translation: A monk who guards his mouth and mind and doesn't transgress the many evils in his body has purified the three courses of action and attained the noble path.

source_sentence: 若人打罵不還報，　　於嫌恨人心不恨，　　於瞋人中心常淨，　　見人為惡自不作。』」
translation: If someone doesn't retaliate for being scolded, his mind doesn't hate the person he hates, his heart is always purified when he's angry, and he doesn't do evil when he sees it.'"

source_sentence: 「七佛為世尊，　　能救護世間，　所可說戒經，　　我已廣說竟。
translation: "I've explained in detail the seven buddhas who are the world-honored ones and can protect the world, as well as the sutras on precepts that can be explained.

source_sentence: 諸佛及弟子，　　恭敬是戒經，　恭敬戒經已，　　各各相恭敬，　慚愧得具足，　　能得無為道。」
translation: All the buddhas and their disciples respect this sutra on precepts, and after they respect the sutra on precepts, they each honor each other, attain fulfillment of conscience, and attain the path of nonproductivity."

source_sentence: 「諸大姊！
translation: "Great sisters!

source_sentence: 已說波羅提木叉竟，僧一心得布薩。」
translation: After explaining the prātimokṣa, the saṃgha became unified in his intention to proclaim it."

source_sentence: 五分比丘尼戒本
translation: Mahāsaṃbhikṣuṇī Prātimokṣa
